Description:
Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll.
This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.


Author: Markus Neis, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential PowerShell Execution Via DLL
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((process_path like '%\installutil.exe' or process_path like '%\regasm.exe' or process_path like '%\regsvcs.exe' or process_path like '%\regsvr32.exe' or process_path like '%\rundll32.exe') and (original_file_name = 'installutil.exe' or original_file_name = 'regasm.exe' or original_file_name = 'regsvcs.exe' or original_file_name = 'regsvr32.exe' or original_file_name = 'rundll32.exe')) and (command like '%default.getstring%' or command like '%downloadstring%' or command like '%frombase64string%' or command like '%icm %' or command like '%iex %' or command like '%invoke-command%' or command like '%invoke-expression%'))
